main event: A witness observed a bright object in the night sky in Murfreesboro, North Carolina, on 14 February 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as being about twice as bright as Venus., It appeared to grow larger and then dim before becoming bright again., The object was mostly stationary but occasionally moved., The sighting lasted between 3 to 5 minutes., The report notes that it was stationary most of the time and made no particular sound.
sighted object: a bright object resembling a star
witness description: P. F. C. Harold P. Nichols, 19, male
